text: python: attributes on a generator object
Is it possible to create an attribute on a generator object?

code:
def filter(x):
    for line in myContent:
        if line == x:
            yield x

text: Now say I have a lot of these filter generator objects floating around... maybe some of them are anonymous...
I want to go back later and interrogate them for what they are filtering for.
Is there a way I can a) interrogate the generator object for the value of x or b) set an attribute with the value of x that I can later interrogate?
